children.value:
is a Higher-order Component that allows mapping
a cancel key event to existing event handler either directly or via a custom function which can
adapt the event payload.

If it is a string, the cancel handler will attempt to invoke a function passed as a prop of
that name. If it is a function, that function will be called with the current props as the
only argument.
If the function handles the cancel action, it should returning
Cancelable instances from also handling the action.

, the Cancelable instance will handle cancel events globally that successfully
bubble up to
regardless of which component is focused.

cancel handlers are processed in reverse of the order they are created such that the
innermost instance (in terms of the component hierarchy) have the first opportunity to handle
the event before its container components.
When set, the Wrapped component will be contained within an instance of

. This may
be necessary if the props passed to Wrapped are not placed on the root element.
Adds an event handler to filter cancel events.

tags.title: param
tags.description:
Function that will receive the event and should return `false` if
							the event is a cancel event.
tags.name: handler

children.value: Function that will receive the event and should return

if
							the event is a cancel event.
